instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3023: What is 820-3023? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: I have a macbook air that will lag on booting into recovery menu and will artifact while trying to install an OS and freeze. I suspected it being ram. I reflowed ram a bit as well as gpu and smc nothing has changed. Is it possible for mac to still boot even with faulty ram?

threads.title: Macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Yeah the usual crap with these, hopeless. Either bad RAM, bad CPU, or cracked solder or traces. Just too many variables to make this a worthwhile repair.

threads.title: Macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Bad CPU or maybe bad traces to the ram. Like duke said, hopeless.

When a customer wants to bring in this model I always ask if it shows graphical glitches or "3 beeps". If its yes I usually don't even take it in anymore

threads.title: Macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Thanks for saving me some time guys.
